LOL, Actually the notion crossed my mind, but I'm not that lacking in 
the mind. *giggle* Thanks! Actually now the hard part is thinking up 
a Bot mode for him..

And plus, Diabo is different from the Visser 3 we both know and 
despise (Actually I like him, but yeah, I reckon he's cool).. *_*

--- In nbwrpg@egroups.com, Yanshosh@a... wrote:
> I thought you were gonna name him Visser III for a second there! 
Cool 
> new char, Teltoli.
> 
> 
> 
> --- In nbwrpg@egroups.com, steph_teltoli@m... wrote:
> > A figure snuck through the woods silently, watching the battle 
> > between the Alliance and the Maximals silently. He had his 
stealth 
> > mode on, so there was no possible way he could be detected, 
unless 
> > one saw the slight indents his hooves made on the ground.
> > 
> > His body was like one of a cenataur, yet slightly different. He 
had 
> > horse legs and body, but where the horse chest would be was a 
> > slightly human torso, with strong looking arms and chest. His 
face 
> > had no mouth, just a nose, pointed ears, and two black almond 
eyes. 
> > Atop his head sat two stalk eyes which could twist in any 
> direction. 
> > Where the horse tail would be, was a 2 meters long tail, with a 
> > scythe like blade, wickedly sharp and coated with poison, on the 
> end.
> > 
> > The stalk eyes swiveled slowly as he watched the battle, deciding 
> the 
> > attakers were indeed stronger, but the defenders had the heart in 
> > them. He sniggered. 
> > 
> > For now, he would be content to watch. 
> > 
> > His Stasis Pod had crashed not too far away from here, but since 
> > everybot was so consumed in this battle, he had snuck out and 
> > discovered the new world on his own.
> > 
> > With a curious cock of his head, he noted neither faction seemed 
to 
> > have any leader. They were both disorganised, frantically firing 
in 
> a 
> > fight to save their lives, no control whatsoever. With simple 
> > planning, the Attackers would win easily.
> > 
> > As he watched, he occasionally heard words being called out. 
Names, 
> > obviously. He didn't have a name. Staring into the night sky with 
> his 
> > stalk eyes, but keeping his main eyes on the battle, a whisper 
> > floated into his head.
> > 
> > 'Diabo..' It said. He would have smiled, if he had a mouth. A 
> perfect 
> > name. A name that protrayed his personality. A name that his 
leader 
> > had used once.
> > 
> > (OOC: Diabo actually means Devil.. or Evil Soul in Spanish.., 
I'll 
> > send in a Profile soon)
